oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Journal of Charles Newell Hammond
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Journal of Charles Newell Hammond (1835-1891). Hammond served with Co. F, 96th Ill. Vol. Inf. Regt., USA. The journal provides an account of the company's rations and expenses as well as his personal account of the mundane events of camp life. On June 25 he wrote, "My 28th birthday, thot [thought] about greens for dinner but had to eat Hard tac & sow belly. The boys nearly all went to the front but I was shoeless & had to stay."
